description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday, April 7, said Indian people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, and not English. Presiding over the 37th meeting of the Parliamentary Official Language Committee, Shah said that when citizens of different states communicate with each other, "it should be in the language of India". â€œPrime Minister Narendra Modi has decided that the medium of running the government is the Official Language, and this will definitely increase the importance of Hindi.
